intro: Corbularia schultesii, commonly known as the Schultes' corbularia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
